privacy.pageDescription: Learn how Bay Area Events collects, uses, and protects your information.
privacy.title: Privacy Policy

section1.title: 1. Introduction
section1.intro: Welcome to Bay Area Events ("we," "our," or "us"), operated by Champagne Grape. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and safeguard your information when you visit our website at https://ymjr.de/ (the "Site").
section1.commitment: We are committed to protecting your privacy and being transparent about our data practices. Please read this policy carefully. If you do not agree with the terms of this privacy policy, please do not access the Site.

automatic.title: 2.1 Information Collected Automatically
automatic.intro: When you visit our Site, we may automatically collect certain information about your device and usage patterns through privacy-focused analytics tools:
automatic.item3: Pages visited and time spent on pages
automatic.item4: Referral source (how you found our Site)
automatic.item5: General geographic region (country/region level, not precise location)

provided.title: 2.2 Information You Provide
provided.intro: When you use our feedback feature, you may voluntarily provide:
provided.item3: Current filter settings (week, location, event type, price range)

analytics.title: 3.1 Analytics and Performance
analytics.description: We use Vercel Web Analytics and Vercel Speed Insights to understand how visitors use our Site and to improve performance. These are privacy-focused, cookie-less analytics tools that do not track individual users across websites or create detailed personal profiles. They help us understand aggregate usage patterns like which pages are most popular and how quickly pages load.

cookies.title: 3.2 Cookies and Similar Technologies

essential.label: Essential cookies:
essential.description: Required for basic site functionality, such as remembering your language preference.

analytics.label: Analytics:
analytics.description: Vercel Analytics uses a privacy-focused approach that does not rely on cookies. It uses pseudonymous session identifiers that cannot be used to identify you personally.

cookies.consent: You can control cookie preferences through your browser settings. A cookie consent banner will appear on your first visit to allow you to make informed choices about non-essential cookies.

section4.title: 4. Feedback Data
section4.intro: When you submit feedback through our Site:
section4.item1: Your feedback is stored in our database (hosted on Turso in the US West region)
section4.item2: We use this feedback solely to improve our event curation and Site features
section4.item3: Feedback is stored with minimal metadata (timestamp, locale, filter state) and no personal identifiers
section4.note: We do not require any personal information to submit feedback, and we do not attempt to identify individual users from their feedback.

section5.title: 5. Data Retention
section5.item1: Analytics data: Retained according to Vercel's standard retention policies (typically aggregated data without individual user tracking)
section5.item2: Feedback data: Retained for approximately one year, after which it may be deleted or anonymized for aggregate analysis
section5.note: We do not create detailed individual profiles from the information we collect.

section6.title: 6. Data Sharing
section6.intro: We do not sell, rent, or share your personal information with third parties for their marketing purposes. We may share data with:

vercel.label: Vercel:
vercel.description: Our hosting and analytics provider, which processes data according to their privacy policy

turso.label: Turso:
turso.description: Our database provider for storing feedback data, which processes data according to their privacy policy

section6.safeguards: These service providers are contractually obligated to protect your data and use it only for the purposes of providing their services to us.

section7.title: 7. International Data Transfers
section7.description: Our Site is hosted on Vercel's global infrastructure, and our database is hosted in the US West region. If you are accessing our Site from outside the United States, please be aware that your information may be transferred to, stored, and processed in the United States. By using our Site, you consent to such transfers. Our service providers maintain their own privacy frameworks and data protection practices.

section8.title: 8. Your Rights
section8.intro: Depending on your location, you may have certain rights regarding your data:
section8.item1: Access: Request information about data we hold about you
section8.item2: Deletion: Request deletion of any feedback you have submitted
section8.item3: Opt-out: Disable cookies through your browser settings
section8.item4: Complaints: Lodge a complaint with your local data protection authority
section8.contact: To exercise these rights, please contact us using the information below.

section9.title: 9. California Residents
section9.intro: If you are a California resident, you have additional rights under the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) and the California Privacy Rights Act (CPRA):
section9.item1: Right to Know: You can request disclosure of the categories and specific pieces of personal information we have collected about you
section9.item2: Right to Delete: You can request deletion of personal information we have collected from you
section9.item3: Right to Opt-Out: We do not sell personal information, so no opt-out is necessary
section9.item4: Right to Non-Discrimination: We will not discriminate against you for exercising your privacy rights
section9.note: Because we collect minimal personal information and do not sell data, most CCPA/CPRA requirements have limited applicability to our Site. To make a request, please contact us at the email address below.

section10.title: 10. Children's Privacy
section10.description: Our Site is not intended for children under 13 years of age. We do not knowingly collect personal information from children under 13. If you are a parent or guardian and believe your child has provided us with personal information, please contact us immediately.

section11.title: 11. Changes to This Privacy Policy
section11.description: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page and updating the "Last Updated" date. We encourage you to review this Privacy Policy periodically for any changes.

section12.title: 12. Contact Us
section12.intro: If you have questions or concerns about this Privacy Policy or our data practices, please contact us:
section12.name: Champagne Grape
